text: In neoclassical economics, economic rent refers to any payment (in the context of a market transaction) made to the owner of a factor of production or resource whose supply is fixed. In classical economics, economic rent is any payment made or benefits received for non-produced, scarce inputs such as location (as in a land lot) and/or assets which are formed by creating official exclusive privileges over natural opportunities and resources. == References == Category:Economics Category:Property
title: Economic rent
